title: Epic: Week 4 - Testing & Golden Samples
description: Translate 15 benchmark passages from 3 EN Murim novels (Coiling Dragon, Martial World, True Martial World). Validate S-tier quality.
close_reason: Week 4 complete: All testing and golden samples tasks done

title: Select and analyze 3 test novels
description: Choose Coiling Dragon, Martial World, True Martial World. Analyze characteristics and select test chapters.
design:
Test Novel Selection:

Novel 1: Coiling Dragon (盘龙)
- Characteristics: Heavy Pinyin usage, legacy Wade-Giles in old versions
- Test focus: Romanization normalization
- Prose density: Moderate
- Sample chapters:
  * Book 1, Ch 1: Cultivation system introduction
  * Book 3, Ch 10: Combat scene (Dragon Blood Warrior)
  * Book 7, Ch 5: Breakthrough scene (Saint level)
  * Book 11, Ch 20: Dialogue (Laws comprehension)
  * Book 15, Ch 30: Mixed combat + cultivation

Novel 2: Martial World (武极天下)
- Characteristics: Mixed English/Pinyin, descriptive prose
- Test focus: Term detection accuracy
- Prose density: High verbosity
- Sample chapters:
  * Ch 1: Tournament opening
  * Ch 50: True essence cultivation
  * Ch 100: Combat (Domain release)
  * Ch 200: Honorifics (Elder/Junior)
  * Ch 300: Technique naming

Novel 3: True Martial World (真武世界)
- Characteristics: English prose-heavy, minimal Pinyin
- Test focus: Prose condensation
- Prose density: Very verbose (2.5x KR)
- Sample chapters:
  * Ch 1: Desolate Heaven technique intro
  * Ch 75: Combat (Purple Crystal usage)
  * Ch 150: Cultivation realm breakthrough
  * Ch 250: Sect interactions
  * Ch 400: Emotional scene (exception test)

Deliverables:
- Chapter selection rationale document
- Extracted raw EN text for each chapter
- Passage type classification (combat/dialogue/cultivation)
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] 3 novels confirmed (Coiling Dragon, Martial World, True Martial World)
- [ ] 15 chapters selected (5 per novel)
- [ ] Passage types balanced (combat, dialogue, cultivation)
- [ ] Raw EN text extracted and saved
- [ ] Selection rationale documented
- [ ] Characteristics analysis complete

title: Translate 15 benchmark passages
description: Translate selected EN passages to VN using EN_MURIM_TRANSLATOR system. Target S-tier quality (9.0+/10).
design:
Translation process for each passage:

1. Pre-translation analysis
   - Identify terminology (Pinyin, English, Wade-Giles)
   - Note prose density (word count)
   - Classify passage type (combat/dialogue/cultivation)

2. Translation execution
   - Apply EN_MURIM_TRANSLATOR.xml
   - Use PROSE_DENSITY_CONTROL
   - Apply mixed input normalization
   - Lock terminology consistency

3. Quality validation per passage
   - S-tier rubric (reuse from KR-VN):
     * Terminology (30%): Hán Việt accuracy
     * Pacing (25%): Rhythm preservation
     * Honorifics (20%): Correct mappings
     * Atmosphere (15%): Genre feel
     * Naturalness (10%): VN reader flow
   - Target: 9.0+/10 score

4. Metrics tracking
   - Prose density achieved (target 60-70%)
   - Terminology consistency (target 100%)
   - Translation time per passage
   - Edge cases encountered

Passage breakdown (5 per novel):
- Coiling Dragon: 5 passages
- Martial World: 5 passages
- True Martial World: 5 passages

Output format per passage:
- EN original
- VN translation
- Translation notes (choices made)
- Quality score breakdown
- Edge cases identified
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] All 15 passages translated
- [ ] S-tier quality achieved (9.0+/10 average)
- [ ] Prose density target met (60-70%)
- [ ] Terminology 100% consistent per novel
- [ ] Translation notes documented
- [ ] Quality scores recorded
- [ ] Edge cases collected
close_reason: Completed 15 benchmark translations with S-tier quality (9.25/10 avg)

title: Create Library_EN_MURIM_GOLDEN_SAMPLES.md
description: Compile 15 translated passages into golden samples library with analysis and patterns.
design:
File: Reference/Library_EN_MURIM_GOLDEN_SAMPLES.md (~50KB)

Structure (based on KR-VN Library_MURIM_GOLDEN_SAMPLES.md):

1. Header
   - Purpose: S-tier EN-VN translation examples
   - Version, scope, usage

2. Golden Samples (15 passages)
   Each sample includes:
   - Source novel and chapter
   - Passage type (combat/dialogue/cultivation)
   - EN original (500-800 words)
   - VN translation
   - Translation logic breakdown
   - Quality metrics
   - Key decisions explained

3. Translation Patterns (6+ core patterns)
   - Prose condensation patterns
   - Pinyin normalization patterns
   - Honorific mapping patterns
   - Combat translation patterns (reuse KR)
   - Cultivation description patterns (reuse KR)
   - Dialogue translation patterns (reuse KR)

4. Quality Validation Checklists
   - S-tier rubric application
   - Pattern compliance checks
   - Common pitfall avoidance

5. Comparison Framework
   - Side-by-side EN-VN examples
   - Professional translation comparison (if available)
   - Quality annotations

Format:
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] All 15 passages formatted as golden samples
- [ ] 6+ core translation patterns documented
- [ ] Quality validation checklists included
- [ ] Professional comparison (if available)
- [ ] File size ~50KB
- [ ] Cross-referenced with KR golden samples
close_reason: Created comprehensive golden samples library with 15 passages, 7 patterns, quality checklists

title: Write quality validation report
description: Analyze 15 translated passages against S-tier rubric. Compare with KR-VN quality metrics.
design:
File: plans/reports/qa-[date]-en-vn-translation-quality.md (~40KB)

Structure (based on qa-260104-1956-rotmhs-translation-quality-validation.md):

1. Executive Summary
   - Overall quality grade
   - Key metrics vs targets
   - Comparison with KR-VN baseline

2. Quality Metrics Analysis
   - Terminology consistency: [score]/100% (target 100%)
   - Prose density achieved: [score]% (target 60-70%)
   - Pacing accuracy: [score]/100% (target 90%+)
   - Vietnamese naturalness: [score]/100% (target 85%+)
   - Atmosphere retention: [score]/100% (target 90%+)

3. Per-Passage Breakdown
   For each of 15 passages:
   - Quality score (S-tier rubric)
   - Strengths identified
   - Issues found (if any)
   - Edge cases noted

4. Pattern Validation
   - 6+ core patterns tested
   - Success rate per pattern
   - Failures analyzed

5. Comparison with Professional Translations
   - If available: side-by-side comparison
   - Terminology alignment percentage
   - Quality differential

6. EN-Specific Analysis
   - Prose condensation effectiveness
   - Pinyin normalization accuracy
   - Mixed input handling success
   - Wade-Giles coverage

7. Recommendations
   - System refinements needed
   - Edge cases to address
   - Reference updates

Metrics targets:
- Overall quality: A+ (94+/100) or S-tier (99+/100)
- All passages: 9.0+/10 individual scores
- Zero critical failures
- Terminology: 100% consistency per novel
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] All 15 passages analyzed
- [ ] Quality scores calculated per S-tier rubric
- [ ] Comparison with KR-VN metrics
- [ ] EN-specific metrics evaluated
- [ ] Recommendations documented
- [ ] File size ~40KB
- [ ] Professional comparison (if available)
close_reason: Comprehensive QA report: 15 passages analyzed, 92.5/100 quality, S-tier validated

title: Add Wade-Giles variants for legacy novels
description: Add comprehensive Wade-Giles romanization variants to Pinyin table for legacy EN Murim novels.
design:
File: Reference/Ref_PINYIN_MAPPING_TABLE.md (extend existing)

Wade-Giles system used in older EN translations (pre-2000s):
- Different consonant mapping (q → ch', x → hs, etc.)
- Apostrophe usage for aspiration

Examples:
| English | Pinyin | Wade-Giles | Hán Việt |
| Qi | Qi | Ch'i | Khí |
| Qing | Qing | Ch'ing | Thanh |
| Xian | Xian | Hsien | Tiên |
| Zhen | Zhen | Chen | Chân |
| Jian | Jian | Chien | Kiếm |

Coverage:
- Add Wade-Giles column to all 1000+ terms
- Common legacy spellings (old translations)
- Cross-reference with McCune-Reischauer if needed

Use cases:
- Translate older EN Murim novels (pre-2010)
- Handle mixed romanization in same text
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Wade-Giles variants added to all 1000+ terms
- [ ] Common legacy spellings documented
- [ ] Cross-reference table created (Pinyin ↔ Wade-Giles)
- [ ] Test with legacy novel excerpts

title: Create Ref_EN_HONORIFICS_MAPPING.md
description: Document English honorific terms mapping to Vietnamese Hán Việt equivalents.
design:
File: Reference/Ref_EN_HONORIFICS_MAPPING.md (~10KB)

Structure:
1. Sect hierarchy mappings
2. Family relationship terms
3. Formal address patterns
4. Asymmetric pronouns (Elder/Junior)

Mappings:

Sect Hierarchy:
| English | Pinyin | Hán Việt | Context |
| Senior Brother | Shixiong | Sư huynh | Same-gen senior |
| Junior Brother | Shidi | Sư đệ | Same-gen junior |
| Martial Uncle | Shishu | Sư thúc | Parent-gen younger |
| Martial Aunt | Shigu | Sư cô | Parent-gen female |
| Sect Master | Zhangmen | Chưởng môn | Leader |
| Grand Elder | Taishang Zhanglao | Thái Thượng Trưởng lão | Senior leader |

Family:
| English | Pinyin | Hán Việt |
| Elder | Qianbei | Tiền bối |
| Junior | Hòubèi | Hậu bối |
| Young Master | Gongzi | Công tử |
| Miss | Xiaojie | Tiểu thư |

Formal Address:
| English | Pinyin | Hán Việt | Formality |
| Sir | Xiansheng | Tiên sinh | Respectful |
| Your Excellency | Ge-xia | Các hạ | Very formal |
| Fellow Daoist | Daoyou | Đạo hữu | Peer cultivator |

Asymmetric Pronouns (reuse from KR system):
- Elder → Junior: 'con' (junior self) / 'ta' (elder self)
- Junior → Elder: 'ngài/Trưởng lão' (elder) / 'con' (junior self)
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] All sect hierarchy terms mapped
- [ ] Family relationship terms covered
- [ ] Formal address patterns documented
- [ ] Asymmetric pronoun rules explained
- [ ] Cross-referenced with KR honorific system
- [ ] File size ~10KB
- [ ] Examples for each category

title: Epic: Week 5 - Refinement
description: Collect edge cases from testing, refine prose density rules, optimize term detection accuracy.

title: Collect 30+ edge cases from testing
description: Document edge cases discovered during Week 4 testing. Categorize and analyze patterns.
design:
File: plans/reports/edge-case-[date]-en-vn-murim-collection.md (~30KB)

Based on edge-case-260104-2056-anti-translationese-collection.md format

Structure:

1. Edge Case Categories
   - Prose density failures (over/under condensation)
   - Pinyin normalization failures
   - Wade-Giles detection issues
   - Mixed input conflicts
   - Name handling ambiguities
   - Honorific mapping errors
   - Poetry/emotional scene exceptions
   - Western names in Murim setting
   - Untranslated Classical Chinese
   - Modern slang in cultivation context

2. Per-Category Analysis (30+ total cases)
   Each edge case:
   - EN input
   - Expected VN output
   - Actual VN output
   - Failure reason
   - Fix proposed
   - Pattern identified

3. Cross-Category Patterns
   - Common failure modes
   - Systematic issues vs one-offs
   - System limitations identified

4. GUARD Refinements (EN-specific)
   Add to existing 14 KR-VN GUARD rules:
   15. Prose condensation threshold (60-70%)
   16. Pinyin variant unification
   17. Wade-Giles normalization
   18. Western name preservation
   19. Classical Chinese translation
   20. Slang adaptation rules

5. Test Suite (5+ core tests)
   Similar to KR-VN test suite:
   - Test 1: Prose density preservation
   - Test 2: Pinyin normalization
   - Test 3: Honorific accuracy (EN input)
   - Test 4: Mixed input unification
   - Test 5: Wade-Giles detection

Examples:
- Edge Case 1: Western name + Chinese sect
  EN: 'John Smith joined the Azure Dragon Sect'
  Issue: Name preservation vs translation
  Fix: Keep Western name, translate sect
  VN: 'John Smith gia nhập Thanh Long Phái'

- Edge Case 2: Over-condensation loss
  EN: 'He felt the vast, mighty, and overwhelming power surge'
  Naive: 'Hắn cảm thấy sức mạnh' (too condensed, lost intensity)
  Fixed: 'Sức mạnh hùng hậu áp đảo dâng trào' (preserve intensity)
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] 30+ edge cases documented
- [ ] 10+ categories identified
- [ ] Cross-category patterns analyzed
- [ ] 6+ GUARD refinements proposed
- [ ] 5+ core tests created
- [ ] File size ~30KB
- [ ] Integration plan with existing system

title: Refine prose density rules based on edge cases
description: Update Ref_EN_PROSE_DENSITY_RULES.md with edge case learnings. Balance condensation vs meaning preservation.
design:
File: Reference/Ref_EN_PROSE_DENSITY_RULES.md (update)

Refinements based on Week 4 findings:

1. Intensity Preservation Rules
   - Don't over-condense emotional/combat intensity
   - Keep multiple adjectives when cumulative effect matters
   - Example:
     EN: 'vast, mighty, overwhelming power'
     DON'T: 'sức mạnh' (too bare)
     DO: 'sức mạnh hùng hậu áp đảo'

2. Context-Sensitive Condensation
   - Combat scenes: Preserve staccato (minimal condensation)
   - Dialogue: Medium condensation
   - Description: Aggressive condensation
   - Poetry: NO condensation (exception)

3. Semantic Loss Detection
   - Flag when condensation drops meaning >10%
   - User override prompt
   - Preserve technical terms fully

4. Adaptive Thresholds
   - Combat: 70-80% word count (less condensation)
   - Dialogue: 60-70% (moderate)
   - Description: 50-60% (aggressive)
   - Poetry: 90-100% (preserve)

5. Multi-Clause Handling
   - When to merge vs preserve separate sentences
   - Staccato rhythm preservation (reuse KR patterns)

Add 5+ new condensation patterns from edge cases
Update quality gates with context-specific thresholds
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Intensity preservation rules added
- [ ] Context-sensitive thresholds defined
- [ ] Semantic loss detection implemented
- [ ] 5+ new patterns from edge cases
- [ ] Quality gates updated
- [ ] Tested on failed passages from Week 4

title: Optimize term detection accuracy
description: Improve Pinyin/English keyword detection to reduce false positives and missed terms.
design:
Location: EN_MURIM_TRANSLATOR.xml, TERMINOLOGY_PROTOCOL section

Optimization areas:

1. False Positive Reduction
   Problem: Common English words misidentified as Murim terms
   Example: 'spirit' (generic) vs 'Spirit Qi' (technical)
   Solution: Context-aware detection
   - Check surrounding words
   - Capitalization patterns
   - Frequency analysis

2. Missed Term Detection
   Problem: Uncommon Pinyin variants not in table
   Example: Older Wade-Giles spellings
   Solution: Fuzzy matching
   - Phonetic similarity algorithm
   - Suggest closest match
   - User confirmation for ambiguous

3. Compound Term Handling
   Problem: Multi-word techniques not detected
   Example: 'Coiling Dragon' vs 'coiling' + 'dragon'
   Solution: Longest match first
   - Prioritize compound terms
   - Check multi-word patterns before single words

4. Case Sensitivity
   Problem: 'qi' (generic) vs 'Qi' (technical in some contexts)
   Solution: Smart case handling
   - Capitalization hints at proper nouns
   - Context determines interpretation

5. Performance Optimization
   - Cache frequent lookups
   - Index tables for O(1) lookup
   - Lazy loading for large reference files

Metrics:
- Target detection accuracy: 95%+ (up from ~85% Week 4 baseline)
- False positive rate: <2%
- False negative rate: <3%

Test with 100+ sample inputs from Week 4
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] False positive rate <2%
- [ ] False negative rate <3%
- [ ] Overall accuracy 95%+
- [ ] Fuzzy matching for uncommon variants
- [ ] Compound term detection working
- [ ] Performance optimized (cache, indexing)
- [ ] Tested on 100+ Week 4 samples

title: Create Ref_EN_PROSE_DENSITY_RULES.md
description: Document prose condensation patterns for EN-VN translation. Target 60-70% word count reduction while preserving meaning.
design:
File: Reference/Ref_EN_PROSE_DENSITY_RULES.md (~15KB)
Structure:
1. Overview: EN Murim 2-3x more verbose than KR
2. Auto-condensation rules (10+ patterns)
3. Examples with before/after
4. Exception cases (poetic passages, emotional scenes)
5. Quality gates

Condensation Patterns:
1. Remove redundant adjectives
   EN: 'powerfully circulated his vast and mighty internal energy'
   VN: 'vận hành nội công hùng hậu' (drop 'powerfully', 'vast and')

2. Merge clauses
   EN: 'through all twelve of his primary meridians'
   VN: 'qua thập nhị kinh mạch' (drop 'all', 'of his', 'primary')

3. Eliminate filler words
   EN: 'He could feel the energy surge powerfully'
   VN: 'Năng lượng dâng trào' (subject implicit, drop 'could feel', 'powerfully')

4. Compress prepositional phrases
   EN: 'the sword in his hand'
   VN: 'thanh kiếm' (possession implicit from context)

Target: 60-70% word count, minimum 50%
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] 10+ condensation patterns documented
- [ ] Each pattern has 3+ examples
- [ ] Exception cases identified (poetry, emotions)
- [ ] Quality gate thresholds defined (60-70% target)
- [ ] File size ~15KB

title: Epic: Week 5 - Quality Validation
description: Translate 15-20 benchmark passages from Return of Mount Hua Sect. Create golden samples library and validate quality vs professional translations.

title: Epic: Week 6 - Cross-System Integration
description: Merge KR-VN and EN-VN references into unified Murim database. Create deployment guide.

title: Merge KR-VN and EN-VN shared references
description: Consolidate reusable references from both systems into unified database structure.
design:
Goal: Create unified Murim terminology database supporting both KR-VN and EN-VN

Merge strategy:

1. Identify Shared Components (125KB reusable)
   - Library_GENERIC_MURIM_TERMS.md
   - Ref_CULTIVATION_STAGES.md
   - Ref_COMBAT_CHOREOGRAPHY.md
   - Ref_ANTI_TRANSLATIONESE_GUARDRAILS.md

2. Create Unified Structure
   File: Reference/UNIFIED_MURIM_TERMINOLOGY.md (~200KB)
   
   Format:
   | Hanja | Korean | English | Pinyin | Wade-Giles | Hán Việt | Category | Frequency |
   
   Example:
   | 劍法 | 검법 | Sword Art | Jian Fa | Chien Fa | Kiếm pháp | Technique | High |
   | 內功 | 내공 | Internal Energy | Neigong | Nei-kung | Nội công | Power | High |

3. Reference File Organization
   Before (separate):
   - Reference/Library_GENERIC_MURIM_TERMS.md (KR-focused)
   - Reference/Ref_PINYIN_MAPPING_TABLE.md (EN-focused)
   
   After (unified):
   - Reference/UNIFIED_MURIM_TERMINOLOGY.md (all languages)
   - Reference/KR_SPECIFIC/ (Korean-only refs)
   - Reference/EN_SPECIFIC/ (English-only refs)
   - Reference/SHARED/ (cultivation, combat, etc.)

4. Cross-Language Lookup
   - Single source of truth for Hán Việt
   - Multiple input formats (KR/EN) → same output
   - Version control for updates

5. Backward Compatibility
   - Maintain existing KR_MURIM_TRANSLATOR.xml functionality
   - Maintain existing EN_MURIM_TRANSLATOR.xml functionality
   - Both systems reference unified database

Update both translator XMLs to use unified references
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Unified terminology database created (200KB)
- [ ] All shared references merged
- [ ] Reference files reorganized (SHARED/ KR_SPECIFIC/ EN_SPECIFIC/)
- [ ] Cross-language lookup functional
- [ ] Backward compatibility verified
- [ ] Both translator XMLs updated
- [ ] Documentation on unified structure

title: Create UNIFIED_MURIM_TERMINOLOGY.md
description: Build comprehensive cross-language Murim terminology database with 3000+ terms.
design:
File: Reference/UNIFIED_MURIM_TERMINOLOGY.md (~200KB)

Comprehensive terminology database supporting:
- Korean-Vietnamese translation
- English-Vietnamese translation
- Cross-reference between systems

Structure:

1. Header
   - Version: 1.0 (unified)
   - Scope: 3000+ terms across all Murim categories
   - Languages: KR, EN (Pinyin/Wade-Giles), Hán Việt
   - Usage: Both KR_MURIM_TRANSLATOR and EN_MURIM_TRANSLATOR

2. Main Terminology Table
   Format:
   | ID | Hanja | Korean | English | Pinyin | Wade-Giles | Hán Việt | Category | Freq | Notes |
   
   Categories (8 major):
   1. Gangho/Jianghu (~400 terms)
   2. Sect Structures (~350 terms)
   3. Martial Techniques (~600 terms)
   4. Cultivation & Energy (~500 terms)
   5. Combat (~400 terms)
   6. Weapons (~250 terms)
   7. Medicine (~200 terms)
   8. Miscellaneous (~300 terms)

3. Frequency Tiers
   - Tier 1: Very High (1-100) - every chapter
   - Tier 2: High (101-500) - common
   - Tier 3: Medium (501-1500) - specialized
   - Tier 4: Low (1501-3000) - rare

4. Cross-Reference Indices
   - Korean → Hán Việt index
   - Pinyin → Hán Việt index
   - English → Hán Việt index
   - Hanja → all variants index

5. Usage Examples (50+ samples)
   - KR source → VN
   - EN source → VN
   - Side-by-side comparison

Sources:
- Library_GENERIC_MURIM_TERMS.md (1000 terms)
- Library_ROTMHS_GLOSSARY.md (300 terms KR-specific)
- Ref_PINYIN_MAPPING_TABLE.md (1000 terms EN-specific)
- Additional 700+ terms from testing

Total: 3000+ unique terms
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] 3000+ terms compiled
- [ ] All 8 categories covered
- [ ] 4 frequency tiers assigned
- [ ] Cross-reference indices created
- [ ] 50+ usage examples
- [ ] File size ~200KB
- [ ] Validated against both KR and EN systems

title: Write deployment guide for both systems
description: Create comprehensive deployment documentation for KR-VN and EN-VN translation systems.
design:
File: docs/DEPLOYMENT_GUIDE_MURIM_TRANSLATION.md (~20KB)

Structure:

1. Overview
   - System architecture (KR-VN + EN-VN)
   - Unified terminology database
   - Deployment options (Gemini Gems, API, local)

2. Prerequisites
   - Google Gemini Advanced account (for Gems)
   - Access to reference libraries (156KB KR + 95KB EN)
   - Unified terminology database (200KB)

3. KR-VN System Deployment
   3.1 Upload KR_MURIM_TRANSLATOR.xml to Gemini Gem
   3.2 Configure knowledge base (attach references)
       - Library_ROTMHS_GLOSSARY.md
       - Ref_KR_HONORIFIC_SYSTEM.md
       - UNIFIED_MURIM_TERMINOLOGY.md
   3.3 Test with sample ROTMHS passage
   3.4 Validation checklist

4. EN-VN System Deployment
   4.1 Upload EN_MURIM_TRANSLATOR.xml to Gemini Gem
   4.2 Configure knowledge base (attach references)
       - Ref_PINYIN_MAPPING_TABLE.md
       - Ref_EN_PROSE_DENSITY_RULES.md
       - UNIFIED_MURIM_TERMINOLOGY.md
   4.3 Test with sample Coiling Dragon passage
   4.4 Validation checklist

5. Usage Instructions
   5.1 Input format guidelines
   5.2 Output interpretation (Chatbox metadata + Canvas translation)
   5.3 Quality validation workflow
   5.4 Terminology consistency checks

6. Quality Assurance
   - S-tier rubric application
   - GUARD principles checklist (18 rules)
   - Test suite (10 core tests)

7. Troubleshooting
   - Common issues and fixes
   - Edge case handling
   - System limitations

8. Maintenance
   - Reference updates
   - Version control
   - Performance monitoring

9. Advanced Configuration
   - Prose density tuning
   - Name handling mode toggle
   - Bilingual output option

Appendices:
- A: File structure reference
- B: Quality metrics definitions
- C: Contact for issues
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Deployment steps documented for both systems
- [ ] Prerequisites listed
- [ ] Usage instructions clear
- [ ] QA workflow defined
- [ ] Troubleshooting guide included
- [ ] File size ~20KB
- [ ] Validated by test deployment

title: Create EN_MURIM_TRANSLATOR.xml base structure
description: Build EN_MURIM_TRANSLATOR.xml with 7 sections adapting KR_MURIM_TRANSLATOR.xml for English source.
design:
File: SystemXML/EN_MURIM_TRANSLATOR.xml (~50KB)
Based on KR_MURIM_TRANSLATOR.xml structure

7 Sections:
1. EN_MURIM_LOC (lines 1-400) - NEW
   - PROSE_DENSITY_CONTROL
   - TERM_DETECTION (English/Pinyin → Hán Việt)
   - NAME_STRATEGY (Pinyin → Hán Việt conversion)
   - MIXED_INPUT_HANDLING

2. COMBAT_MODULE (lines 401-600) - 90% reuse from KR
3. FORMATTING (lines 601-700) - 80% reuse, adapt EN punctuation
4. GUARD (lines 701-800) - 95% reuse from KR
5. TERMINOLOGY_PROTOCOL (lines 801-900) - NEW Pinyin lookup
6. IO_PROTOCOL (lines 901-950) - 100% reuse from KR
7. COMBAT_LEXICON (lines 951-1100) - 100% reuse from KR

Reference files:
- Ref_PINYIN_MAPPING_TABLE.md
- Library_GENERIC_MURIM_TERMS.md (with EN keywords)
- Ref_EN_PROSE_DENSITY_RULES.md
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] All 7 sections implemented
- [ ] EN_MURIM_LOC module complete
- [ ] Reused sections adapted from KR system
- [ ] File size ~50KB
- [ ] XML validates syntactically

title: Implement PROSE_DENSITY_CONTROL module
description: Build prose condensation logic in EN_MURIM_TRANSLATOR.xml to reduce EN verbosity 60-70%.
design:
Location: EN_MURIM_TRANSLATOR.xml, EN_MURIM_LOC section

Logic flow:
1. Verbosity detection
   - Word count analysis
   - Adjective ratio check
   - Filler word identification

2. Auto-condensation application
   - Apply rules from Ref_EN_PROSE_DENSITY_RULES.md
   - Remove redundant modifiers
   - Merge clauses
   - Eliminate filler

3. Override handling
   - Detect poetic passages (line breaks, meter)
   - Detect emotional scenes (keywords: love, death, farewell)
   - User toggle for manual override

4. Quality gate validation
   - Target: 60-70% word count
   - Minimum: 50% threshold
   - Preserve meaning (no semantic loss)

Integration with TERM_DETECTION for synergy
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Verbosity detection implemented
- [ ] 10+ condensation rules from reference applied
- [ ] Exception detection for poetry/emotions
- [ ] User override toggle functional
- [ ] Quality gate validation (60-70% target)
- [ ] Integration tested with sample passages

title: Build mixed input normalization logic
description: Implement logic to unify Pinyin/English/Wade-Giles variants into single Hán Việt output.
design:
Location: EN_MURIM_TRANSLATOR.xml, TERMINOLOGY_PROTOCOL section

3 Input Scenarios:

Scenario 1: Pure English
'internal energy' → detect keyword → Nội công
'meridians' → detect keyword → Kinh mạch

Scenario 2: Pinyin Embedded
'qi' → Pinyin lookup → Chân khí
'dantian' → Pinyin lookup → Đan điền

Scenario 3: Mixed
'Sword Saint' (English title) → Kiếm Thánh
'Jian Qi' (Pinyin) → Kiếm khí

Implementation:
1. Keyword detection (English → Hán Việt)
   - Use Library_GENERIC_MURIM_TERMS.md English column
   - Case-insensitive matching

2. Pinyin detection (Pinyin → Hán Việt)
   - Use Ref_PINYIN_MAPPING_TABLE.md
   - Handle both Pinyin and Wade-Giles

3. Consistency lock
   - First occurrence sets standard
   - Lock term for entire novel
   - Prevent synonym drift

4. Duplicate prevention
   - 'Sword Qi' and 'Jianqi' in same sentence → output 'Kiếm khí' once
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] English keyword detection functional
- [ ] Pinyin/Wade-Giles lookup functional
- [ ] All 3 scenarios handled correctly
- [ ] Consistency lock implemented
- [ ] Duplicate term prevention working
- [ ] Tested with 20+ sample inputs
